management

Class TextualEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • management.Entry
      • management.TextualEntry

  • public class TextualEntry
extends Entry
    The TextualEntry class stores any textual information that belongs to a module.

    It is an extension of the Entry class.

    This class might be the most used and useful extension, because any data can be stored in it. Data just has to be in textual form.

    Several Constructors are given, but only a few are useful. Use only Constructors that are marked as "useful". All other Constructors are used for test purposes.

    Author:
    AJ, add names here...
    See Also:
    Module, Entry, SelfStudy

      • TextualEntry

        public TextualEntry(java.lang.String date,
            boolean classification,
            boolean approvalstatus,
            boolean declined,
            long entryID,
            java.lang.String title,
            int order,
            java.lang.String text)
        Creates a TextualEntry with given parameters. (Overloaded)

        Difference: used to create an Entry from already loaded data.

        useful

        Parameters:
        version - The version of this Entry-extension. (Used to initialize the super class)
        date - The modification date. (Used to initialize the super class)
        classification - Should this entry go to Dezernat 2 ? (Used to initialize the super class)
        approvalstatus - Is this entry already approved ? (Used to initialize the super class)
        declined - Is it declined and needs to be rewritten again ? (Used to initialize the super class)
        entryID - This entry's ID. (Used to initialize the super class)
        title - The title of this entry. Used by the document creation as content title. (Used to initialize the super class)
        order - The order of this entry. (Used to initialize the super class)
        text - The textual content.

      • TextualEntry

        public TextualEntry(java.lang.String title,
            int order,
            java.lang.String text)
        Creates a TextualEntry with given parameters. (Overloaded)

        Difference: used to create an Entry from scratch, that can be filled with new content. The super class is initialized with default values for new Entry.

        useful

        Parameters:
        title - The title of this entry. Used by the document creation as content title. (Used to initialize the super class)
        order - The order of this entry. (Used to initialize the super class)
        text - The textual content.
